chargeHist.descr: Neglecting a Child - Specified Harm Did Not Occur and Child Under 6 Years of Age
Neglecting a Child - Specified Harm Did Not Occur and Child Under 6 Years of Age

result.execSummary:
The defendant Alexis S. Wall was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Neglecting a Child (No Harm and Child < 6 Yrs or Disability) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.21(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
**6 days credit, if revoked**
If Probation or Extended Supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Concurrent with: 21CF351

miscConds.notes: PAYABLE DIRECTLY TO AND COLLECTED BY EAU CLAIRE COUNTY CLERK OF COURT.  NOT A CONDITION OF PROBATION.
No contact with any known drug dealers/users except in a therapeutic setting.

Comply with Department of Human Services regarding K.D. and G.W. 
Participate in and successfully complete Eau Claire County Treatment Court Program. 
Maintain absolute sobriety; Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations. 
Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge.

timeConds.notes:
No Huber privileges.  
All but first 30 days stayed pending further order of the court.

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt:
Administrative Transfer to Treatment Court.
IT IS ORDERED: this case is transferred to Branch 1 while defendant is a participant in the Treatment Court program.  The case will be administratively reassigned back to the initial court upon defendant's successful completion of the Eau Claire County Treatment Court Program, or upon defendant's termination from that program.

(Cases 21CF351, 22CF507 are called at 8:17 AM)
Participant appears in person with Treatment Court Team. 
Review of progress in Treatment Court Program.
Reminder Notice indicating amount due mailed to defendant.
See PLEAH docket dated 5/11/2022.

(Cases 22CF507, 21CF351 are called at 11:55 AM) Defendant Alexis S. Wall in court, in custody without counsel.  Attorney Matthew Kirkpatrick in court for State of Wisconsin. 
SPD filed a letter indicating they are working on appointing counsel. State recites offer to the Defendant. Defendant wants to take the offer. Court has colloquy with Defendant regarding right to an attorney. Defendant waives right to an attorney. Court revokes Deferred Acceptance of a Guilty Plea Agreement in 21CF351 and finds the Defendant guilty. State notes the offer includes 22CF507. Defendant waives right to a preliminary hearing and Court accepts waiver in 22CF507. Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. Defendant pleads Guilty to 22CF507 Count 1- Neglecting a Child as Repeater. Defendant acknowledges prior convictions. Court accepts plea and finds the Defendant guilty. Remaining charges are dismissed and read in. 
Court withholds sentence and orders 36 months Probation with the following conditions: 9 months jail on Count 1 in 22CF507 with No Huber privileges, all but first 30 days stayed pending further order of the court- Court orders if Treatment Court Program is not completed, remaining jail be served with Huber; No contact with any known drug dealers/users except in a therapeutic setting; Comply with Department of Human Services regarding K.D. and G.W.; Participate in and successfully complete Eau Claire County Treatment Court Program; Maintain absolute sobriety; Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations; Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge; Court costs. 6 days jail credit, if revoked in 22CF507. No jail credit, if revoked in 21CF351.
Renumbering Counts 3-4 to Counts 1-2.

Conditions:
No contact with K.D. or G.K.W. without DHS approval.
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety. 
Defendant not to consume/possess any alcohol or go into any taverns, bars, liquor stores/place where alcohol is primarily served/sold. 
Comply with DHS directive.

11:01 AM case called.  Prosecuting attorney Trenton John Piltz Mr in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Alexis S. Wall appeared by video, in custody with Attorney Zeb Patek. 
Waives reading of the complaint and time limits for the preliminary hearing. Pre-Trial Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on 5/23/22 at 3:30 PM. 
Return to court 6/16/22 at 9:30 AM.

Conditions:
No contact with K.D. or G.K.W. without DHS approval.
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety. 
Defendant not to consume/possess any alcohol or go into any taverns, bars, liquor stores/place where alcohol is primarily served/sold. 
Comply with DHS directive.
CO-DEFENDANT
